member.name: IDedupReadFileCallback.OrderContainersRestore

summary.para: This method provides the application with the ability to influence the order of the pending reads that are required to retrieve the target file.

Given a list of container files that hold data for the restore target file, generates a list of container file extents in a sorted order that results in an efficient cross-container read plan from the backup store.
Implementation of this method by the application is optional.

member.param: Number of container paths in the ContainerPaths array.

Array of paths to container files that must be read in order to restore the file specified in theIDedupBackupSupport.RestoreFilescall. Each element is a full path from the root directory of the volume to a container file.
Pointer to a ULONG variable that receives the number of structures in the array that the ReadPlan parameter points to.
Pointer to a buffer that receives an array of structures.
member.returns: This method can return standard HRESULT values, such asS_OK. It can also return convertedsystem error codes using the macro. Possible return values include the following.

member.name: IDedupReadFileCallback.PreviewContainerRead
member.summary: Provides the application with a preview of the sequence of reads that are pending for a given container file extent.
member.param: The full path from the root directory of the volume to the container file.
Number of structures in the array that the ReadOffsets parameter points to.
Pointer to an array of structures.
member.returns: This method can return standard HRESULT values, such as S_OK. It can also return converted system error codes using the macro. Possible return values include the following.

member.name: IDedupReadFileCallback.ReadBackupFile
member.summary: Reads data from a Data Deduplication store metadata or container file located in the backup store.
member.param: The full path from the root directory of the volume to the container file.
The offset, in bytes, from the beginning of the file to the beginning of the data to be read.
The number of bytes to read from the file.
A pointer to a buffer that receives the data that is read from the file. The size of the buffer must be greater than or equal to the number specified in the SizeToRead parameter.

Pointer to a ULONG variable that receives the number of bytes that were read from the backup store. If the call to ReadBackupFile is successful, this number is equal to the value that was specified in the SizeToRead parameter.
This parameter is reserved for future use.
member.returns: This method can return standard HRESULT values, such as S_OK. It can also return converted system error codes using the macro. Possible return values include the following.

member.name: IDedupReadFileCallback
member.summary: A callback interface, implemented by backup applications, that enables Data Deduplication to read content from metadata and container files residing in a backup store and optionally improve restore efficiency.
